Name: Start of growing season
Description: Start of growing season (defined by start of greenup). Landsat based.

Name: Number of Vegetation Cycles
Description: Total number of valid vegetation cycles with peak in product year

Name: First Greenup Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 15% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: First Greenup Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 15% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Mid Greenup Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 50% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Mid Greenup Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 50% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Peak EVI2 Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 reached the segment maximum, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Peak EVI2 Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 reached the segment maximum, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Maturity Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 90% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Maturity Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 first crossed 90% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Mid Greendown Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 50% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Mid Greendown Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 50% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Senescence Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 90% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Senescence Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 90% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Dormancy Date (Cycle 1)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 15% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 1. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: Dormancy Date (Cycle 2)
Description: Date when EVI2 last crossed 15% of the segment EVI2 amplitude, cycle 2. Days since Jan 1, 1970

Name: EVI2 Area Under Curve (Cycle 1)
Description: Sum of daily interpolated EVI2 from Greenup to Dormancy, cycle 1

Name: EVI2 Area Under Curve (Cycle 2)
Description: Sum of daily interpolated EVI2 from Greenup to Dormancy, cycle 2

Name: SR_B1
Description: Band 1 (ultra blue, coastal aerosol) surface reflectance

Name: Minimum temperature
Description: minimum temperature for a given month (°C)

Name: Maximum temperature
Description: maximum temperature for a given month (°C)

Name: Mean temperature
Description: mean temperature for a given month (°C)

Name: Total precipitation
Description: total precipitation for a given month (mm)

Name: Mean temperature of the warmest month
Description: mean temperature of the warmest month (°C)

Name: Mean temperature of the coldest month
Description: mean temperature of the coldest month (°C)

Name: Temperature difference
Description: difference between mcmt and mwmt, as a measure of continentality (°C)

Name: Annual heat moisture index
Description: annual heat moisture index, calculated as (mat+10)/(map/1000)

Name: Summer heat moisture index
Description: summer heat moisture index, calculated as mwmt/(MSP/1000)

Name: Frost-free start day
Description: the julian date on which the frost-free period begins

Name: Frost-free end day
Description: the julian date on which the frost-free period ends

Name: Mean annual solar radiation
Description: mean annual solar radiation (MJ m-2 d-1)

Name: Land Cover Class (SCANFI)
Description: NFI land cover class values including broadleaf forest, mixedwood, conifer forests, shrub, and water

Name: Fractional Broadleaf
Description: Proportion of the canopy covered by broadleaf tree species (%)

Name: Human footprint
Description: Human Footprint from the ABMI Wall-to-Wall Vegetation Layer

Name: Vegetation Type (ABMI)
Description: Vegertation type from the ABMI Wall-to-Wall Vegetation Layer

Name: Slope
Description: Terrain slope is the rate of change of elevation, expressed in degrees or percentages. Important for soil erosion, water flow, and agricultural suitability.

Name: Aspect
Description: The angular direction that a slope faces, expressed in degrees. Sine (aspect-sine) and cosine (aspect-cosine) are used for regression analysis and reprojection.

Name: Northness
Description: A continuous measure describing the north-south orientation of a slope, calculated as the sine of the slope multiplied by the cosine of the aspect.

Name: Eastness
Description: A continuous measure describing the east-west orientation of a slope, calculated as the sine of the slope multiplied by the sine of the aspect.

Name: Convergence
Description: Highlights convergent areas (channels) and divergent areas (ridges), ranging from -100 for ridges to +100 for sink areas. Useful in delineating landforms.

Name: Compound Topographic Index
Description: A proxy for long-term soil moisture availability, computed as the logarithm of the cumulative upstream catchment area divided by the tangent of the local slope angle.

Name: Stream Power Index
Description: Reflects the erosive power associated with water flow, calculated as the product of the upstream catchment area and the tangent of the local slope angle. Commonly used in soil erosion models.

Name: Terrain Ruggedness
Description: Describes ruggedness and topographic complexity within an area. Derived using DEMs with a moving window approach to measure topographic variability.

Name: Elevation Standard Deviation
Description: Measures the amount of variation within the elevation dataset using a 3x3 moving window. Values close to 0 indicate flat areas, while high values indicate steep terrain.

Name: Terrain Ruggedness Index
Description: Mean of the absolute differences in elevation between a focal cell and its 8 surrounding cells. Indicates terrain ruggedness.

Name: Roughness
Description: Largest inter-cell absolute difference between a focal cell and its 8 surrounding cells, indicating terrain ruggedness. Expressed in metres.

Name: Vector Ruggedness Measure
Description: Quantifies terrain ruggedness by measuring the 3D orientation of grid cells using sine and cosine of slope. Captures local variation of slope in terrain.

Name: Topographic Position Index
Description: Difference between the elevation of a focal cell and the mean of its 8 surrounding cells. Positive values indicate ridges, negative values indicate valleys.

Name: Multiscale Deviation
Description: Unitless measure of topographic position, representing the difference between elevation of the center cell and surrounding cells divided by standard deviation.

Name: Multiscale Roughness
Description: Spherical standard deviation of the sum of 3D vector components used to calculate vector ruggedness. Provides roughness measurement over different window sizes.

Name: Geomorphon
Description: Geomorphological forms classified into 10 terrain types (flat, ridge, valley, etc.) extracted from DEMs using morphometry techniques. Useful for landslide susceptibility, human mobility, and ecosystem service assessments.

Name: Topographic Wetness Index
Description: ln(α/tanβ)) where α=cumulative upslope drainage area and β is slope [@sorensen2007effects]
